discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To connect a computer that lacks a 9-pin serial port to a point-of-sale system using a 9-pin serial adapter, you would typically use a USB-to-Serial adapter. So, the correct answer is:

C. USB

You would plug the USB-to-Serial adapter into an available USB port on the computer, and it would provide a 9-pin serial port for connecting to the point-of-sale system.

Selected Answer: C
Picked USB: You can use a usb-to-serial adapter to connect a point-of-sale system with a 9-pin serial adapter if the computer doesn't have the serial port.

A. HDMI: Not used for serial communication.
B. Bluetooth: I believe bluetooth can establish a virtual serial connection wirelessly but that doesn't really work here for a pos system that needs a traditional direct serial connection with the 9-pin serial port. 
D. Lightning: There is a lighting-to-serial cable but the question said that the technician is replace a computer, not an iOS device. A lightning to serial adapter wouldn't make sense here.
Someone should please give explanation on this question.
C- A 9-pin serial to USB adapter can be used to connect the point-of-sale system to a USB port on the new computer.

Selected Answer: C
It's C - USB
Dont mind be, im also waiting for an answer

questions.question_text:
A technician is replacing a computer with a connected point-of-sale system using a 9-pin serial adapter. The new computer does not have a 9-pin serial port.
Which of the following ports can an adapter be installed on in order to connect to the point-of-sale system?

discussion.content: The network type that would be used in a server room to connect virtual servers to high-speed storage is D. SAN (Storage Area Network). A SAN is a dedicated high-speed network that connects servers to storage devices, such as disk arrays or tape libraries, allowing for efficient data transfer and management. SANs are commonly used in data centers or server rooms to provide fast and reliable access to storage for servers and other network devices. WAN (Wide Area Network) is a network that connects devices over a large geographic area, while PAN (Personal Area Network) is a network used for connecting devices in close proximity to each other, and MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) is a network that covers a larger geographic area than a LAN (Local Area Network) but smaller than a WAN
Wow I don't think Mike Meyers even mentioned SAN in his comptia videos this is completely new to me

Selected Answer: D
A storage area network (SAN) is a dedicated network that connects servers to high-speed storage devices. SANs are used to provide high-performance storage for virtual servers.

questions.question_text: Which of the following network types would be used in a server room to connect virtual servers to high-speed storage?

id go with D because HDMI cables also provide audio.

The reason why I choose D is because it doesn't tell us what type of DVI the PC is using. There several different types of DVI based on this Google image "Different Types of DVI Cables Chart | Warehouse Cables" So D is the answer!

Selected Answer: D
HDMI is for image and audio, that's right answer.

Selected Answer: B
this is the correct anwers

Options A, B, and C are unrelated to the audio issue. Changing the input on the projector to VGA or the output on the PC to DVI won't address the audio problem because neither VGA nor DVI carries audio signals. Modifying the projector's refresh rate is unlikely to affect the audio, as it mainly pertains to the display's refresh rate, not the audio output.
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
HDMI Need Plug in

Selected Answer: D
D. Utilizing an HDMI connection is the most likely solution to resolve the issue of the projector having video but no audio when a user is attempting to give a presentation via a projector in a conference room. HDMI (High-Definition Multimedia Interface) supports both video and audio signals in a single cable, making it a common interface used to connect devices such as PCs to projectors. Changing the input on the projector to VGA, changing the output on the PC to DVI, or modifying the projector's refresh rate are not relevant solutions for this scenario, as they do not address the issue of the projector having video but no audio.

Selected Answer: D
hdmi has audio and video

Selected Answer: D
hdmi contains video and sound capabilities

questions.question_text:
A user, who is attempting to give a presentation via a projector in a conference room, reports that the projector has video but no audio. Which of the following will
MOST likely resolve the issue?

choices.A: Changing the input on the projector to VGA
choices.B: Changing the output on the PC to DVI

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. M.2 NVMe SSD

The M.2 NVMe SSD (Non-Volatile Memory Express) is the fastest data storage device that can be installed on a laptop. It offers much faster data access speeds compared to other storage options like SATA or SAS. The NVMe protocol allows for quicker access to the stored data, making it an excellent choice for upgrading the laptop to have the fastest data access possible. Additionally, the M.2 form factor is compact and space-saving, making it an ideal solution for laptops where space is limited.

Selected Answer: B
M.2 NVMe SSDs are the fastest type of storage available. They use the NVMe protocol, which is designed for high-performance storage. M.2 NVMe SSDs are also the most expensive type of storage.
B is the best

questions.question_text: A desktop support technician is tasked with upgrading a laptop so that it has the fastest data access possible. Which of the following BEST satisfies this requirement?

The Chief Executive Officer wants to ensure company data is stored in a manner that provides the company with complete control over how the data is managed.
Which of the following is the BEST cloud deployment model for this request?

discussion.content: D too easy

Selected Answer: D
The BEST cloud deployment model for the CEO's request of complete control over how company data is managed would be a private cloud. In a private cloud, the cloud infrastructure is operated solely for a single organization, and it can be managed internally or by a third-party. This allows the organization to have complete control over the management of data and ensures that the data is stored in a manner that meets the company's security and compliance requirements.

Selected Answer: D
only the company has control over data so it has to be private.
